1: <sup>1</sup> O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.
2: <sup>2</sup> Let the redeemed of the LORD say so, whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the enemy;
3: <sup>3</sup> And gathered them out of the lands, from the east, and from the west, from the north, and from the south.
4: <sup>4</sup> They wandered in the wilderness in a solitary way; they found no city to dwell in.
5: <sup>5</sup> Hungry and thirsty, their soul fainted in them.
6: <sup>6</sup> Then they cried unto the LORD in their trouble, and he delivered them out of their distresses.
7: <sup>7</sup> And he led them forth by the right way, that they might go to a city of habitation.
8: <sup>8</sup> Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!
9: <sup>9</sup> For he satisfieth the longing soul, and filleth the hungry soul with goodness.
10: <sup>10</sup> Such as sit in darkness and in the shadow of death, being bound in affliction and iron;
11: <sup>11</sup> Because they rebelled against the words of God, and contemned the counsel of the most High:
12: <sup>12</sup> Therefore he brought down their heart with labour; they fell down, and there was none to help.
13: <sup>13</sup> Then they cried unto the LORD in their trouble, and he saved them out of their distresses.
14: <sup>14</sup> He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, and brake their bands in sunder.
15: <sup>15</sup> Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!
16: <sup>16</sup> For he hath broken the gates of brass, and cut the bars of iron in sunder.
17: <sup>17</sup> Fools because of their transgression, and because of their iniquities, are afflicted.
18: <sup>18</sup> Their soul abhorreth all manner of meat; and they draw near unto the gates of death.
19: <sup>19</sup> Then they cry unto the LORD in their trouble, and he saveth them out of their distresses.
20: <sup>20</sup> He sent his word, and healed them, and delivered them from their destructions.
21: <sup>21</sup> Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!
22: <sup>22</sup> And let them sacrifice the sacrifices of thanksgiving, and declare his works with rejoicing.
23: <sup>23</sup> They that go down to the sea in ships, that do business in great waters;
24: <sup>24</sup> These see the works of the LORD, and his wonders in the deep.
25: <sup>25</sup> For he commandeth, and raiseth the stormy wind, which lifteth up the waves thereof.
26: <sup>26</sup> They mount up to the heaven, they go down again to the depths: their soul is melted because of trouble.
27: <sup>27</sup> They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, and are at their wit’s end.
28: <sup>28</sup> Then they cry unto the LORD in their trouble, and he bringeth them out of their distresses.
29: <sup>29</sup> He maketh the storm a calm, so that the waves thereof are still.
30: <sup>30</sup> Then are they glad because they be quiet; so he bringeth them unto their desired haven.
31: <sup>31</sup> Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!
32: <sup>32</sup> Let them exalt him also in the congregation of the people, and praise him in the assembly of the elders.
33: <sup>33</sup> He turneth rivers into a wilderness, and the watersprings into dry ground;
34: <sup>34</sup> A fruitful land into barrenness, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.
35: <sup>35</sup> He turneth the wilderness into a standing water, and dry ground into watersprings.
36: <sup>36</sup> And there he maketh the hungry to dwell, that they may prepare a city for habitation;
37: <sup>37</sup> And sow the fields, and plant vineyards, which may yield fruits of increase.
38: <sup>38</sup> He blesseth them also, so that they are multiplied greatly; and suffereth not their cattle to decrease.
39: <sup>39</sup> Again, they are minished and brought low through oppression, affliction, and sorrow.
40: <sup>40</sup> He poureth contempt upon princes, and causeth them to wander in the wilderness, where there is no way.
41: <sup>41</sup> Yet setteth he the poor on high from affliction, and maketh him families like a flock.
42: <sup>42</sup> The righteous shall see it, and rejoice: and all iniquity shall stop her mouth.
43: <sup>43</sup> Whoso is wise, and will observe these things, even they shall understand the lovingkindness of the LORD.
